headline: Why Paccar Stock Slipped on Tuesday
summary: Paccar (NASDAQ: PCAR) published its fourth-quarter and full-year 2024 results Tuesday morning, and investors didn't seem too impressed by its performance.  For the quarter, Paccar's total revenue was just over $7.9 billion, representing a notable come-down from the nearly $9.1 billion in the same period of 2023.  While Paccar beat the average analyst estimate of nearly $7.6 billion for revenue, it fell a bit short of that for profitability.

headline: PACCAR's Q4 Earnings Disappoint, Plans Infrastructure Spending And Tech Investments
summary: PACCAR Inc. (NASDAQ:PCAR) shares are trading lower on Tuesday. The company reported fourth-quarter earnings per share of $1.66, missing the street view of $1.69. Quarterly sales of $7.36 billion missed the analyst consensus estimate of $7.62 billion. “Infrastructure spending is driving steady demand for Kenworth and Peterbilt’s industry-leading vocational trucks,” said Laura Bloch, PACCAR senior vice president. “The less-than-truckload segment is also performing well.” For the fourth quarter of

headline: PACCAR's fourth-quarter results dented by sluggish freight market, higher costs
summary: PACCAR has also been battling high production costs as it expands its offering to powertrains and emissions-free vehicles.  "Infrastructure spending is driving steady demand for Kenworth and Peterbilt's industry-leading vocational trucks," PACCAR's Senior Vice President Laura Bloch said in a statement.  Bellevue, Washington-based PACCAR reported a profit of $1.66 per share for the quarter ended Dec. 31, down from $2.70 per share in the year-ago period.

headline: Paccar (PCAR) Lags Q4 Earnings and Revenue Estimates

headline: PACCAR (NASDAQ:PCAR) Misses Q4 Sales Targets
summary: Trucking company PACCAR (NASDAQ:PCAR) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2024, with sales falling 14.3% year on year to $7.36 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.66 per share was 1.5% below analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: PACCAR (NASDAQ:PCAR) Misses Q4 Sales Targets

headline: PACCAR Achieves Strong Annual Revenues and Net Income
summary: BELLEVUE, Wash., January 28, 2025--"PACCAR reported strong annual revenues and net income in 2024," said Preston Feight, chief executive officer. "PACCAR’s results reflect the enhanced profitability of the latest generation of DAF, Peterbilt and Kenworth trucks, record PACCAR Parts revenue and profit, and good financial services performance.
